page.title: 16Airlie Monument,Cortachy
page.content: Above the winding glen of Prosen,high on Tulloch Hill,towers the{Airlie {Monument.}It was erected in{1901}in memory of the{9th Earl of Airlie}who was tragically killed at the{Battle of {Diamond Hill}on the 11th of June 1900, during the{Boer War.}A rough track winds its way through the wooded hill up to the monument.A hedge of cotoneaster surrounds the base and a few steps lead up to the door.Once inside it is very dark as the windows had to be boarded up because of van- dals.A steep spiral staircase leads up to a small room with narrow windows and continues upwards to a balcony on top of the monument, from which there is a beautiful view. On the balcony is a brazier which is one of a chain,lit in succession throughout the country, on the occasion of{Prince Charles's } marriage to{Lady Diana Spencer.}
